title: Purple Folders
content:
Support It seems a number of my file folders are corrupted. They show up as purple instead of the normal B&W. I say they are corrupted because, though I can still see them, as well as still put emails in and access the one in the folder, I lose the ability to do things specifically with the folders themselves. I'm attaching two screen shots

  1. 1 shows the normal folder.
  2. 2 shows the "Purple Folder" for comparison to normal.

On examination you can see some capabilities are not avaiable, i.e. DELETE, RENAME ect What causes this ? How can these "Purple Folder" be fixed? tx tom

Thomas J Meehan CAPTTJM@HOTMAIL.COM
creator: capttjm

title: Can receive emails in TB but can not send
content:
We have two IMAP email accounts which use smtp.outlook365.com to send emails via Thunderbird 115.7.0 One account stopped being able to send about six months ago but I could not resolve the problem with either your help pages or by comparing with account settings with the address which could send emails successfully. This week the second account can not send emails either. Both accounts receive all incoming emails. We have Kaspersky VPN and have switched this off without it making any difference.

Our smtp settings are:- smtp.office365.com port 587 STARTTLS Normal password (I have tried OAuth2 and No authentication but none helped) user.name@outlook.com

The error message on sending says :- Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.office365.com timed out. Try again.

Any help would be appreciated.
creator: BlueMoss75

title: All mails downloaded on initial mail account set up
content:
I have installed TB on a new device and want to set up my mail accounts with only the last 3 months mail for each one.

I understand the IMAP account settings for "Synchronization & Storage" & "Disk Space" where indeed you can set the download by size or time.

The problem is that those settings are only accessible once the mail account is set up.

The mail account set up itself initiates the download of all mail from the server the instant the account is set up which is then not adjustable until after that initial download is complete. 

i.e. there appears to be no way to stop the entire mailbox from the server being downloaded.

Does anyone know a way to time limit that initial download or indeed prevent any initial download until the account settings can be used to do so?
creator: adrianbates

title: Using FileLink
content:
I have an email message describing issues with an installation to send to the installer. It has eleven attachments. It's saved in the Drafts folder. Obviously it's too large to send in this state so I've investigated what services are available. I used WeTransfer in the past but this seems to limit the message size. I installed FileLink using the default service. The message now has a Thunderbird Send button on the menu bar (next to the Attach button) but clicking it does nothing. I don't want to use the Attach button though since all the files are already attached. Clicked Send and saw the usual warnings about the message size being way too large for the server. Wondered how FileLink will work. Read the FileLink help again and decided to detach everything and attach them again using Attach > FileLink > Thunderbird Send. I navigate to the folder of interest and select the first group of four photos. A panel is displayed for one of files containing Info, Options and Donate buttons, with Download limit and Time limit drop-down lists. Two "Make sure it is less than ..." statements point me to the Send service provider. I don't know how to get there though so I populate with numbers, which turn out to be too high when I click encrypt and upload, and an error box is shown. 1 download and 3 days seems to work. Sending this message on a Friday is probably not the best idea as nothing is expected to happen before Monday and 3 days is too tight. I could be resending the message next week. I add the next batch of files and another panel pops up for one of them, and I duly respond. Presumably the others are ok? Attachments at the bottom of the message window have 'working' roundels by them so I put the laptop on one side to let them do their thing while I sip my tea. Refreshments over and back to TB. Still in progress but while changing between windows I notice more panels are lurking, one for each attachment, which was unexpected. Making the same choices for each attachment is a bind (excuse the pun). Nine files are uploaded and two smaller screenshots remain as regular attachments. I check over the download URLs embedded in the message. I modify the message content accordingly and send it.

I would value step-by-step instructions for this process. It's one that I do infrequently so I can't remember what I did before! Must be my age.

Any suggestions gratefully received. The workflow above may be incomplete but it's what I recall.

Richard
creator: Rich57

title: ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùê≠ùê® ùêèùê´ùêûùêØùêûùêßùê≠ ùêîùê©ùêùùêöùê≠ùêûùê¨ ùê≠ùê® ùêìùê°ùêÆùêßùêùùêûùê´ùêõùê¢ùê´ùêù
content:
ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùê≠ùê® ùêèùê´ùêûùêØùêûùêßùê≠ ùêîùê©ùêùùêöùê≠ùêûùê¨ ùê≠ùê® ùêìùê°ùêÆùêßùêùùêûùê´ùêõùê¢ùê´ùêù As a regular here, I have frequently seen requests on how to prevent updates to Thunderbird. For most people, I believe the option found at Settings>General is sufficient. I also believe the default setting to automatically apply updates is appropriate if users do periodic backups. But I respect there are those who have strong feelings on the topic, and those who run a business and rely on stability more than new features. I acknowledge this information may be available elsewhere, and possibly superior in its approach, but this does work. So, here are the steps: 

-   Create a simple text file called policies.json  -   Enter this text into the file:     {      "policies": {         "ManualAppUpdateOnly": true,         "AppAutoUpdate": false,         "AppUpdateURL": "https://yoursiteisnothere.com"       }    }  - create a folder named ‚Äòdistribution‚Äô and store it in the folder where thunderbird.exe resides. For Windows, that would be normally be C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird\ or C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Thunderbird\ - place the file called policies.json in the distribution directory - start Thunderbird  - to verify this, click Settings>General and scroll down to Updates. There, you should see the words,            ‚ÄúFailed to check for updates.‚Äù  (See attached screenshots for examples.)

If you later decide you want an update, the file or folder must be removed or renamed. If changes are made while Thunderbird is running, you must exit and restart for the change to take effect.

NOTE: My suggestion to persons using this technique is to, at least twice per year, download the latest version, test to your satisfaction along with any addon updates. The intent is to stay relatively current for releases, security, and support. To never update is not recommended.
creator: davidsk

title: Thunderbird does not display sent messages
content: Hello! I use Thunderbird (currently 115.7) on Arch Linux. I store mails in maildir format. The problem is, that when I navigate to a Sent folder, Thunderbird lists the messages in the Sent folder, but does not display any content of a message. If I choose to open a sent message in a new tab or window, this tab or window is completely blank, including the tab header. The error console does not log any message related to this. Any other folder (like Inbox, Trash or in Local Folders) show mails ok. When browsing with a file manager to the sent messages on the disk, then the messages are there with the correct content, as far as I can see. At least I can read the mail body like this. So, what could cause Thunderbird to list sent mails but not display them? Any help is appreciated. And if I can provide more useful information, I will do. Thanks, Andreas
creator: supernobby

title: Persistent Login Failure
content:
In Thunderbird I use two email accounts. The btinternet.com seems to Login ok but my Hotmail persistently fails to Login, with error message: Login to server imap-mail.outlook.com with username h.d.clark@hotmail.com FAILED. I have tried re-entering password but still no Login.

Please can you help? If you need me to be online, I'm on UK time (Time Zone Z).

Thank you, H.D.C.
creator: h.d.clark

title: Dealing with all email deleted from inbox.
content: My wife discovered today that all email had disappeared from her inbox! She doesn't know how or why and neither do I. She is running Thunderbird 1.15 under Windows 7. I have already tried the Windows restore function on the INBOX and it didn't work. Tried a number of other methods and none worked. In looking around the Thunderbird directory and noticed a bunch of files named nstmp-1, 2 3 and 4. nstmp-4 has this morning date-time on it and viewing it in an editor it seems to be a backup of the INBOX. Is this true, and can it be used to rebuild her INBOX.
creator: frankzen

title: block list
content:
I have a suggestion for Thunderbird. I use the block list feature all the time to block e-mail addresses and or domains that are spamming or phishing me. It takes me quite a few clicks to navigate and complete the process for each e-mail I receive that I want to block in the future. It would be nice to have a selection beside the delete button to block this e-mail address and then a option to also block that domain.

Thank you
creator: jcgragg
